intro: Ebnerella mazatlanensis, commonly known as the Mazatlan spurge, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It produces a distinctive yellowish-green latex that is often used in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
